title: How to Clear the Cache on your Samsung TV

steps.title: Turn off your TV.
steps.content: Turn off your TV. You may be able to clear your cache and fix any issues you are having with your TV by performing a soft reset. You can do this on any Samsung TV model. It's recommended you do this once every few weeks or so. To begin, start by powering off your TV with the remote.

steps.title: Press and hold the power button on your TV.
steps.content: Press and hold the power button on your TV. Locate the power button on your TV panel. Press and hold it for about 15 to 30 seconds. Then release the power button. This will perform a soft reset, which will clear the cache. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Press the Home button on your remote.
steps.content: Press the Home button on your remote. It's the button that has an icon that resembles a house. It's in the center of the remote. This displays a menu bar. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Select Settings.
steps.content: Select Settings . It has an icon that resembles a gear. It's on the far left side of the menu bar at the bottom. Use the remote to navigate to the far left side of the menu bar and select the Settings icon. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Select Support.
steps.content: Select Support . It's the second from the last option in the Settings menu. It's next to an icon that resembles a cloud. Use the remote to select this option.

steps.title: Select Device Care.
steps.content: Select Device Care . It's the second option in the Support menu. When you select this option, your TV will do a quick diagnostic check. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Select Manage Storage.
steps.content: Select Manage Storage . It's the first tab at the bottom of the screen on the left. Select this option to display a list of apps you have installed on your TV . [5] X Research source

steps.title: Highlight an app you want to clear the cache for.
steps.content: Highlight an app you want to clear the cache for. Use the remote to highlight the different apps in the list. You can only clear the cache for one app at a time. To clear everything all at once, you'll need to perform a soft reset.

steps.title: Select View Details.
steps.content: Select View Details . This option appears below an app that you have highlighted in the menu.

steps.title: Select Clear Cache.
steps.content: Select Clear Cache . It's the second option in the pop-up menu. This clears the cache. [6] X Research source Additionally, you can select Clear Data . This will erase all data associated with the app. Do this if you continue to experience problems with the app. If you continue having problems with your TV, you may want to consider resetting it to its factory default settings .

steps.title: Select TV Device Manager.
steps.content: Select TV Device Manager . It's the fourth option in the Self Diagnosis menu. This displays some options you can use to improve your TVs performance. It also displays a few charts that tell you how much CPU and RAM your TV is using.

steps.title: Select Clean Now below "Memory Boost."
steps.content: Select Clean Now below "Memory Boost." It's the first option at the bottom of the page. This will clear some cached memory as a way to boost performance.

steps.title: Select Clean Now below "Clean Running Apps."
steps.content: Select Clean Now below "Clean Running Apps." It's the second option at the bottom of the screen. This will close any apps that are running in the background.

steps.title: Select Show App List.
steps.content: Select Show App List . It's the last option at the bottom of the page. This displays a list of all apps you have downloaded to your television .

steps.title: Press the Home button on your remote.
steps.content: Press the Home button on your remote. It's the button that has an icon that resembles a house. It's in the center of the remote. This displays the Home menu.

steps.title: Select Apps.
steps.content: Select Apps . It's the second icon at the top. It's a green icon with an image that resembles a series of squares.

steps.title: Select Settings .
steps.content: Select Settings . It's the icon that resembles a gear in the upper-right corner. Use the remote to select the gear icon.

steps.title: Select Privacy & Security.
steps.content: Select Privacy & Security . It's in the menu on the left-hand side of the screen. Use the remote to select this option.

steps.title: Select Delete Browsing Data.
steps.content: Select Delete Browsing Data . It's at the bottom of the Privacy & Security menu.

steps.title: Select Yes.
steps.content: Select Yes . This confirms that you want to delete your cache and deletes all the cache data on your TV. If you continue having problems with your TV, you may want to consider resetting it to its factory default settings .
